channel.title: Quick help when logging in
channel.description: hi i have my own pk server and i want to take off spawning and put in a bank option. What i mean is like when they log in there are already items in there banks a lot of pk server have this what do you think? how can i do this?

item.title: Quick help when logging in
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:6, topic:381199”][quote author=adrian1372 link=topic=477014.msg3489689#msg3489689 date=1296856867]
I noticed not too long ago that not all server “support” automatically putting starters in bank.

Man I s… at explaining.
[/quote]

LOL, it’s not a matter of a server “supporting” that, you would just have to make a method or something. Any server can support anything :|, it’s just the way that some servers are written that is different.[/quote]

^^ Yea what he said!

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help when logging in
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

well like adrian said, depends what base you have…

as a guide, if your source has the initialize() method (or equivalent), look for where it says:

if(starter == 0){

and add under it:

bankItems[0] = itemID;
bankItemsN[0] = Amount;
bankItems[1] = itemID;
bankItemsN[1] = Amount;
bankItems[2] = itemID;
bankItemsN[2] = Amount;

And as many as you want, and each time a new char is created they get that stuff in their bank…

(this depends on the bankItem() method)

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help when logging in
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“adrian1372, post:5, topic:381199”]I noticed not too long ago that not all server “support” automatically putting starters in bank.

Man I s… at explaining.[/quote]

LOL, it’s not a matter of a server “supporting” that, you would just have to make a method or something. Any server can support anything :|, it’s just the way that some servers are written that is different.

find out if your base supports it.

item.title: Quick help when logging in
item.dc:creator: @adrian1372 adrian1372
item.description:
@adrian1372 wrote:

First we need to know which base you use.

I guess your first step is to find out if your base supports it.

Read full topic
